match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: England won by 6 wickets (with 29 balls remaining)

series.name: Bangladesh tour of England, Ireland and Scotland
series.longName: Bangladesh tour of England, Ireland and Scotland

image.caption: A general view of Trent Bridge during the fourth Test
image.longCaption: A general view of Trent Bridge during the fourth Test, England v Australia, Trent Bridge, August 25, 2005

match.hoursInfo: 10.45 start, First Session 10.45-14.15, Interval 14.15-15.00, Second Session 15.00-18.30

headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan run out (Strauss/†Kieswetter) 76 (95b 7x4 0x6 148m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: nonsensical running! Total confusion as Raqibul clips to the wide midwicket. Faisal went nowhere, he must've been watching Raqibul who, obviously, wasn't running. Meanwhile, Shakib had set off for what should've been an easy single. The ball is hurled in to Kieswetter with Shakib stranded in the middle of the wicket. Raqibul grounds his bat, but it doesn't matter - he's out!

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Zunaed Siddique lbw b Yardy 51 (70b 5x4 0x6 90m) SR: 72.85

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Darted in quick again, Junaid tries to clip through midwicket but is hit on the foot. Huge appeal from Yardy, and Asad Rauf agrees! Hitting him on the line of off stump, he was pressing forward but not that far down

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and gone! That will cheer Anderson up! It was fullish around off stump, Kayes leant back and skewed a drive straight to Eoin Morgan at cover. Bit tame that dismissal but England won't mind at all
another sharp, inswinging yorker from Anderson and this one has picked up a wicket! Mahmudullah it was this time, struck on the foot as the ball swung in towards leg stump
big hit... but caught by Bell on the deep midwicket boundary. Mashrafe hit that well, but just couldn't get the distance as the ball caught in the breeze

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiqur goes! Another big hit, this one was straighter though. It was just too full and too straight to get underneath it properly, and though he got a decent connection he couldn't send the ball further than Luke Wright, who had been pushed back to long-on

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full, straight, clatter! Razzaq swings and misses and the ball smashes into his stumps to close the innings.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Broad 28 (22b 4x4 0x6 25m) SR: 127.27

dismissalComment.html: Broad strikes! He's done it again. And a collective groan from all the crowd as Tamim departs. It was nothing more than a straight ball on a length, Tamim aimed another glide to third man, but it was far too close to pull of the shot and it crashed into his pads to trap him in front

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Andrew Strauss run out (Mahmudullah) 50 (37b 7x4 0x6 50m) SR: 135.13

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! Strauss will be furious with this, pushed gently to cover by Kieswetter and after a touch of hesitation Strauss ran through for the single, direct hit from cover, and Strauss, who didn't dive is short by a fraction. Strauss called the run, he should at least have tried to dive in. Ends an excellent innings from the England captain
gone! Kieswetter falls! Kieswetter looked to smash a sweep over deep square for a maximum, but didn't time it perfectly and the man on the boundary takes a good chance above his head

headshotImage.caption: Paul Collingwood player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Paul Collingwood player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shakib gets another! Well done him. Collingwood aimed a fearful mow into the leg side, got a big top edge and Siddique, the stand in keeper, took the catch. Much to the amusement off his team-mates

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oops, Morgan has just gifted his wicket away. He was looking for a leg-side whip through straightish midwicket, but got it too square and sent it straight down the throat of the man on the boundary

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

commentPreTextItems.html: With one run to win, England take the Powerplay - they had to, as there are just five overs left and it hadn't yet been taken!

commentTextItems.html: that's it, all over and England cruise to a six-wicket win as Bell steps back and swipes through cover

commentPostTextItems.html: So, England continue their successful summer. Although this was always expected to be an easy win, it was an important game for them after losing the final two matches of their series against Australia. Ian Bell once again cashes in on Bangladesh's attack with an unbeaten 84 to complete a chase that was set up by a rapid half-century from Andrew Strauss. England's bowling wasn't quite as slick as their batting, and Bangladesh could have got 20 to 30 more with a little more gumption. One felt that they just didn't back themselves to dominate the bowling. As is often the case, Shakib Al Hasan was the pick of their bowling attack.
No update on Mushfiqur as yet - he has gone to hospital for x-rays. "It was a good track to bat on, and England batted beautifully," says Mashrafe.

"We were pretty happy with the work we did with the ball, apart from the start. We always felt we could chase 250, it was a pretty clinical chase from us," says Strauss. "Belly played exceptionally well, he's been dying to get an opportunity and he took his chance today."

And indeed, Ian Bell is Man of the Match. "It was an opportunity to get some time out in the middle with the full side," he says, and credits his recent time with the England Lions for his one-day form too. "I also went back to Warwickshire and worked on a few things Andy Flower told me about when I went out of the side."

For an in-depth look at the teams' performances today, have a look at Andrew Miller's bulletin. That's all from your commentary team - Liam Brickhill and Sahil Dutta - for today. Thanks for joining us for this game, and do join us again for the second game of the series on Saturday. Thanks as well for all the feedback, both to us and on the Facebook page. Keep it coming, we read everything though we're sometimes too busy to post too much of it!

commentTextItems.html: cut away  behind square, and they pick up a couple

headshotImage.caption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: punched out to long-off
arm ball from Shakib! Almost had the beating of Bell, as it nipped in to take the inside edge, ricochet off the pad and just miss the leg stump
pushed down the ground, Shakib tumbles across in his follow-through but can't cut it off
dropped just behind square on the leg side
tip-and-run from Yardy to get Bell back on strike, and Bangladesh have well and truly given up here
Bell comes down the track once again, but this time displays his deft touch in guiding the ball to gully. It was a late cut really, and well-played

headshotImage.caption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: bouncer from Shafiul this time, looked to be a slower one and Bell hooked it from head height down to long leg for another four! England are close now
slapped! Bell is keen to get this over with, as he comes charging down the track and slams a short, wide ball to the cover point boundary
another slower cutter, this time its nudged down to fine leg by Yardy

commentPostTextItems.html: It's probably been discussed before, but Yardy really does have an extraordinary trigger movement. He positions himself a good foot outside leg and shuffles to middle and leg before the ball is bowled.

commentTextItems.html: pacy this time, and Yardy defends into the covers from the crease

commentPreTextItems.html: Shafiul Islam into the attack now. Can he prise out a consolation wicket before the end comes?

commentTextItems.html: slower cutter to start, and it keeps a touch low as Shafiul sends it down just back-of-a-length on middle and off. Bell didn't quite seem to pick it up either, but they get a single
Bell stays deep in the crease and punches off the back foot out to deep cover

headshotImage.caption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: driven out to deep cover
Yardy shuffles across to try and work the angle between midwicket and square leg, but this time picks out that square leg fielder
nudged to midwicket
Bell's first slog of the night with just 20-odd needed, as he aims a heave out to deep midwicket. Didn't middle it though, and the ball plugs in the turf and comes to a stop inside the rope
tossed up by Faisal, who continues to find turn. But well wide of off. Although, even so Bell can only slice to gully
whipped off middle stump, but straight to midwicket

headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Broad 28 (22b 4x4 0x6 25m) SR: 127.27

dismissalComment.html: Broad strikes! He's done it again. And a collective groan from all the crowd as Tamim departs. It was nothing more than a straight ball on a length, Tamim aimed another glide to third man, but it was far too close to pull of the shot and it crashed into his pads to trap him in front

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Morgan b Anderson 14 (34b 2x4 0x6 57m) SR: 41.17

dismissalComment.html: and gone! That will cheer Anderson up! It was fullish around off stump, Kayes leant back and skewed a drive straight to Eoin Morgan at cover. Bit tame that dismissal but England won't mind at all

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Yardy player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Zunaed Siddique lbw b Yardy 51 (70b 5x4 0x6 90m) SR: 72.85

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Darted in quick again, Junaid tries to clip through midwicket but is hit on the foot. Huge appeal from Yardy, and Asad Rauf agrees! Hitting him on the line of off stump, he was pressing forward but not that far down

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Anderson b Broad 20 (36b 2x4 0x6 45m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: good catch! Shakib smashed a wide ball firmly, but just too close to Anderson who held on to a low chance

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Wright player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Wright player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Wright b Bresnan 22 (18b 0x4 2x6 21m) SR: 122.22

dismissalComment.html: Mushfiqur goes! Another big hit, this one was straighter though. It was just too full and too straight to get underneath it properly, and though he got a decent connection he couldn't send the ball further than Luke Wright, who had been pushed back to long-on

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Anderson 4 (7b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: another sharp, inswinging yorker from Anderson and this one has picked up a wicket! Mahmudullah it was this time, struck on the foot as the ball swung in towards leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan run out (Strauss/†Kieswetter) 76 (95b 7x4 0x6 148m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: nonsensical running! Total confusion as Raqibul clips to the wide midwicket. Faisal went nowhere, he must've been watching Raqibul who, obviously, wasn't running. Meanwhile, Shakib had set off for what should've been an easy single. The ball is hurled in to Kieswetter with Shakib stranded in the middle of the wicket. Raqibul grounds his bat, but it doesn't matter - he's out!

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Bell b Anderson 5 (5b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: big hit... but caught by Bell on the deep midwicket boundary. Mashrafe hit that well, but just couldn't get the distance as the ball caught in the breeze

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak b Bresnan 3 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: full, straight, clatter! Razzaq swings and misses and the ball smashes into his stumps to close the innings.

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Strauss player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Andrew Strauss run out (Mahmudullah) 50 (37b 7x4 0x6 50m) SR: 135.13

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! Strauss will be furious with this, pushed gently to cover by Kieswetter and after a touch of hesitation Strauss ran through for the single, direct hit from cover, and Strauss, who didn't dive is short by a fraction. Strauss called the run, he should at least have tried to dive in. Ends an excellent innings from the England captain

dismissalText.long: c Faisal Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Kieswetter c Faisal Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 32 (40b 3x4 1x6 59m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: gone! Kieswetter falls! Kieswetter looked to smash a sweep over deep square for a maximum, but didn't time it perfectly and the man on the boundary takes a good chance above his head

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell not out 84 (101b 6x4 0x6 123m) SR: 83.16

headshotImage.caption: Paul Collingwood player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Paul Collingwood player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c †Junaid Siddique b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Paul Collingwood c †Junaid Siddique b Shakib Al Hasan 33 (49b 1x4 0x6 58m) SR: 67.34

dismissalComment.html: Shakib gets another! Well done him. Collingwood aimed a fearful mow into the leg side, got a big top edge and Siddique, the stand in keeper, took the catch. Much to the amusement off his team-mates

dismissalText.long: c Shafiul Islam b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Shafiul Islam b Abdur Razzak 23 (26b 2x4 1x6 25m) SR: 88.46

dismissalComment.html: oops, Morgan has just gifted his wicket away. He was looking for a leg-side whip through straightish midwicket, but got it too square and sent it straight down the throat of the man on the boundary

notes: Bangladesh innings
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 10.1 overs (66 balls), Extras 7
Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0
Drinks: Bangladesh - 80/2 in 17.0 overs (Junaid Siddique 26, Raqibul Hasan 3)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 20.2 overs (129 balls), Extras 9
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 63 balls (Junaid Siddique 27, Raqibul Hasan 21, Ex 3)
Junaid Siddique: 50 off 67 balls (5 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 31.4 overs (197 balls), Extras 11
Drinks: Bangladesh - 166/3 in 34.0 overs (Raqibul Hasan 49, Shakib Al Hasan 13)
Raqibul Hasan: 50 off 61 balls (5 x 4)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 71 balls (Raqibul Hasan 30, Shakib Al Hasan 20, Ex 0)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 42.5 overs (266 balls), Extras 14
Power Play 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 49.5 overs (310 balls), Extras 19
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 250/9 in 50.0 overs (Faisal Hossain 8)
England innings
England: 50 runs in 6.6 overs (43 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 43 balls (AJ Strauss 31, C Kieswetter 16, Ex 3)
AJ Strauss: 50 off 37 balls (7 x 4)
Power Play 2: Overs 12.1 - 17.0
England: 100 runs in 16.1 overs (100 balls), Extras 6
Drinks: England - 105/2 in 18.0 overs (IR Bell 12, PD Collingwood 5)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 70 balls (IR Bell 25, PD Collingwood 20, Ex 5)
26th over - Mushfiqur Rahim injured and Junaid Siddiqui takes over as the keeper
England: 150 runs in 26.3 overs (163 balls), Extras 16
IR Bell: 50 off 68 balls (3 x 4)
England: 200 runs in 35.5 overs (220 balls), Extras 17
Drinks: England - 204/3 in 37.0 overs (IR Bell 57, EJG Morgan 15)
England: 250 runs in 44.6 overs (275 balls), Extras 19
Power Play 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0

stories.subTitle: 1st ODI

stories.title: Ian Bell feels at home again
stories.subTitle: England v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge
stories.seoTitle: England v Bangladesh: Ian Bell feels at home again

image.caption: After nervy start Ian Bell anchored England's chase with ease
image.longCaption: After nervy start Ian Bell anchored England's chase with ease, England v Bangldesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge, July 8, 2010

stories.title: Bangladesh summon reserves as injuries bite
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in England 2010
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh summon reserves as injuries bite
stories.summary: Bangladesh have called up batsman Mohammad Ashraful, allrounder Naeem Islam and wicketkeeper Saghir Hossain to their squad in England

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim had to be stretchered from the field after being struck in the face by the ball
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim had to be stretchered from the field after being struck in the face by the ball, England v Bangldesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge, July 8, 2010

stories.title: Bell and Strauss flatten Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: England v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge
stories.seoTitle: England v Bangladesh: Bell and Strauss flatten Bangladesh
stories.summary: Andrew Strauss played the hare and Ian Bell the tortoise, as England returned to winning ways by making light work of a decent but ultimately unchallenging target of 251 in the first ODI against Bangladesh at Trent Bridge
stories.byline: The Bulletin by Andrew Miller at Trent Bridge

image.caption: Andrew Strauss was in confident form during his rapid 50
image.longCaption: Andrew Strauss was in confident form during his rapid 50, England v Bangldesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge, July 8, 2010

stories.title: Strauss confident  'world-class' Bell can deliver
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in England 2010
stories.seoTitle: England v Bangladesh: Strauss confident 'world-class' Bell can deliver
stories.summary: Andrew Strauss believes 'world class' Ian Bell has what it takes to replace the resting Kevin Pietersen at No. 3 for England in their one-day series against Bangladesh that starts July 8

image.caption: Ian Bell celebrates his century for England Lions
image.longCaption: Ian Bell celebrates his century for England Lions, England Lions v India A, A Team Tri-series, Worcester, July 6, 2010

stories.title: Broad set to play despite stepmother's death
stories.subTitle: England v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge
stories.seoTitle: England news: Stuart Broad set to play despite stepmother's death
stories.summary: Stuart Broad is set to play in the opening ODI against Bangladesh despite the death of his stepmother, Miche, following her battle with motor neurone disease

stories.title: Tamim the main threat to England
stories.subTitle: England v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Trent Bridge
stories.seoTitle: England v Bangladesh: Tamim Iqbal the main threat to England
stories.summary: England begin their three-match series against Bangladesh at Trent Bridge aiming to stamp their authority after a disappointing finish against Australia
